commands.description: Create a new Zendesk request with subject & description. Caller is the requester. If @User is included, @User is the requester
commands.param: SUBJECT & DESCRIPTION are texts and are separated by a | character. @USER is an @mention (optional)

commands.description:
Add comment to an existing Zendesk ticket

Agent: Add a private/public comment & update ticket status

End user: Add a public comment
commands.param:
TICKET_ID is Zendesk ticket ID

TXT is the comment to be added

STATUS is open, new, pending, solved, closed,...

MODE is 'public' or 'private'

STATUS & MODE are only for Agent
commands.example:
/ZDUpdate 222 | txt

/ZDUpdate 222 | txt | open | private

/ZDUpdate 222 | txt | closed | public

commands.description: Shows Zendesk Ticket comments for Zendesk ticket ID
Search Zendesk tickets by specific organization. Filter results to specific ticket status (e.g. open, unresolved)
commands.param: STATUS = open | new | pending | solved |closed | unresolved | all. ORG is the company name as it appears on Zendesk

commands.description: Search Zendesk tickets by specific category such as Product or Severity. Filter results to specific organisation as well as ticket status (e.g. open, unresolved)
commands.param: STATUS = open | new | pending | solved |closed | unresolved | all. ORG is the company name and CAT is the Product Category or Severity (as it appears on Zendesk)
commands.example:
/ZDCatTicket open symphony WebRTC

/ZDCatTicket symphony WebRTC

/ZDCatTicket open symphony sev3

/ZDCatTicket unresolved sev1

commands.description: Search Zendesk tickets by specific user as requester, assignee or CC/collaborator/follower. If no @mentioned user, the calling user will be used. Filter results to specific ticket status (e.g. open, unresolved)
commands.param:
STATUS = open | new | pending | solved | closed | unresolved | all

TYPE = req | assignee | cc

@USER is an @mention (optional)
